chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth D. Olejnik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kenneth D. Olejnik is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kenneth D. Olejnik was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Kenneth D. Olejnik was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth D. Olejnik

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:11 a.m. Defendant Kenneth D. Olejnik in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss Counts 1 and 4 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters guilty pleas to Count 2 & 3.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig provides Victim Impact letter. Off record 9:17 a.m. 
Defense Exhibits 1 (letter) and 2 (certificate) marked. On record 9:22 a.m. - Court has reviewed letter. Michlig/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court sentence
Count 2
WHS/POP - 2 yrs
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeitures/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office. DNA Surcharge imposed per local court rule 5. 
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
No intoxicants; no taverns
AODA assessment and recovery
Apology letters to RN and law enforcement officers
Costs to be taken from cash bond posted - any balance to be refunded to poster
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

Count 3
WHS/POP - 2 yrs concurrent to Count 2
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeitures/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office. DNA Surcharge imposed per local court rule 5. 
Jail - 5 months with Huber for all purposes.  May be served in Oneida, Langlade or Forest counties. To be commenced within 30 days.
May be released from jail for in-patient treatment at Koinonia - If successfully completes in-patient treatment - day for day credit will be given.
No intoxicants; no taverns
AODA assessment and recovery
Apology letters to RN and law enforcement officers
Costs to be taken from cash bond posted - any balance to be refunded to poster
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO



Appeal rights given
Adj. 10:18 a.m.

1:49 p.m. Defendant Kenneth D. Olejnik in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court takes letter from defendant's father and gives to DA to keep in their file - Court directs DA to advise victim to stop writing the court. Michlig anticipates pre-trial motions - requests date for motion hearing - date can be obtained from judicial assistant. Bail continued.  Jury trial scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

3:32 p.m. Defendant Kenneth D. Olejnik in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files Information. Vorhees in receipt of information, waives reading and enters not guilty plea. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: 02:16 pm - Defendant Kenneth D. Olejnik in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calls Oneida County Sheriff's Deputy Bethany Vandoorn/Sworn/Direct by Michlig - Witness ID's defendant/Cross by Voorhees.  Defense calls defendant, Kenneth Olejnik/Sworn/Direct by Voorhees/Cross by Michlig.  Voorhees motion to dismiss - Court denies motion.  Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

01:37 pm - Defendant Kenneth D. Olejnik in court, via video,  with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Kenneth D. Olejnik in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Voorhees requests Preliminary Hearing within ten days.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

02:31 pm - Defendant Kenneth D. Olejnik in court, via video, with attorney Mary Burns appearing on behalf of attorney John Voorhees.  Defendant Kenneth D. Olejnik in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond filed.  Bond is currently set at $2500 cash with conditions.  Burns/Michlig statement to motion.  Court denies motion.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
No intoxicants/no taverns and no contact with Walter Olejnik - defendant's father .

1:57 pm.:  Judge O'Melia on behalf of Judge Bloom.  Defendant Kenneth D. Olejnik in court, in custody via video.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will  seek counsel/Public Defender.   Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $2500 Cash  bond.  Court states if defendant cannot pay cash bond - court will allow defendant to start treatment rather then sit in jai.
